title: Equity Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Macalester College (Saint Paul, MN) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: My interview with this new equity team was online, efficient, and friendly. They asked good questions, and were forthright with their timeline. The entire process was less than 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you caused harm and how did you handle it.

title: Employer, Alumni, and Parent Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Macalester College in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews, both over zoom. Environment felt pretty casual, if not conversational. Questions were fairly typical, lots of behavioral questions (e.g. tell us about a time you experienced conflict in the workplace).
Interview Questions: What role do you play when working as part of a team?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Macalester College
Interview Descriptions: Very engaged search team. The process gave applicant time to provide thoughtful answers. The process also used mixed modes of written response followed by real-time follow-up. Feedback on status was timely throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Experience with diversity and inclusion

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Macalester College (Saint Paul, MN) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I had a 30-minute phone screen as the first round with the Director of this area. Good questions, respectful of my time, shared the salary range. I was then told that I was one of the top three candidates and completed a final round of interviews within an afternoon.  1) with the director again and senior associate directors 2) with two members of a different department with whom the role works closely 3) with the rest of the team, associate directors and assistant directors. Finally I met with an HR person to discuss the benefits associated with the role. 

It was well-paced and thorough, and respectful of my time. A really positive interview experience.
Interview Questions: Examples and stories of past work: problems solved, conflict with colleague, projects managed

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Macalester College in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds; first is phone, second is in-person. As long as you read the job description and know your resume, you'll be great! There was time as a candidate to ask questions as well.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your interest in the role and Macalester.

title: Work Study Employee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Macalester College
Interview Descriptions: The college ran through the resume and background check to make sure that I was qualified for the job. It was a simple and effective process. It was an overall good experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your resume?

title: Full Stack Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Macalester College (Minneapolis, MN) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: 2 Interviews, 1 phone call, and then a group interview. The phone interview went well, I learned about their current and previous technology stack. The group interview  was also good, I was asked about my experience on a variety of topics.  I would say just make sure to prepare for questions and just be honest in what you know.
Interview Questions: What was my previous experience and skillset

title: IT Services/Help Desk Technitial Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Macalester College
Interview Descriptions: it is a work study job so I did not have to go through interview processes. I just submitted some preference answers before I came to the college. I did not want to work for it at first but I love the job now.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Macalester College
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the usual questions. I felt the HR person was the wrong one to be conducting the interview, as I don't think one person can have an intimate understanding of the particulars of every position at the college. I found her condescending and brusque, and would have liked to know more about the position than she could tell me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you were faced with a challenge and how you responded to it.

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Macalester College (Saint Paul, MN) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were friendly. Standard questions for Residential Assitant interviews on community building. The first interview is in two parts, with two different pairs of people, made up of a Residential Hall Director and a current Residential Assistant. The second interview happened a week after where we are separated into groups.
Interview Questions: How would your past experience help with your responsibilities in this position?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Macalester College
Interview Descriptions: Normally you just talk to the professor and then they would let you know if you got the position or not. If the professor do not have a preceptor, they may select people from the poll of survey answerers who need to indicate their previous experience
Interview Questions: Previous classes taken

title: Prospect Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Macalester College (Saint Paul, MN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and professional, more of a discussion than interview. They started with a Phone Screen, then moved to a group interview that was more of an engaging discussion than being grilled with questions. Overall, a very pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: They asked about my past experiences and how they could be applied to Macalester

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Macalester College (Saint Paul, MN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I give them credit for being quick and polite about the whole interview process. I received an email for a phone screening, and then 4 business days later an email to come in for an interview in just a couple of days after that, and then 5 days later got an email that I didn't get the job. Interview questions were pretty standard.  Conversations each time lasted 30-45 minutes.
Interview Questions: What was an example of using innovation when faced with a problem?

title: Summer Research In the CS Project Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Macalester College (Saint Paul, MN)
Interview Descriptions: I actually just befriended a professor and he asked me about it. He seemed very thrilled with my proactive reaching out for a job. We had a few conversations and he decided to add me to the research even if I hadn't know to apply in the first place.
Interview Questions: Asking about how I worked in a group.

title: ITS Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Macalester College
Interview Descriptions: Submitted app, got job. Work Study
Interview Questions: N/A
